Application.name: uk.ac.starlink/stilts

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-calc
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: calc: Evaluates expressions

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: calc_expression
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: expression - Expression to evaluate
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: An expression to evaluate. The functions in the manual can be used.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: stdout
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: std out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The output from the commandline

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: calc_table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: table - Table providing context for expression
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: A table which provides the context within which expression is evaluated.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-coneskymatch
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: coneskymatch: Crossmatches table on sky position against Cone Search service

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_istream
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: istream - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If set true, the in table will be read as a stream. It is necessary to give the ifmt parameter in this case. Depending on the required operations and processing mode, this may cause the read to fail (sometimes it is necessary to read the input table more than once). It is not normally necessary to set this flag; in most cases the data will be streamed automatically if that is the best thing to do. However it can sometimes result in less resource usage when processing large files in certain formats (such as VOTable).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_icmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd - Processing command(s) for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_ocmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ocmd - Processing command(s) for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the output table, after all other processing has taken place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "ocmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_ra
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ra - Right Ascension expression in degrees (ICRS)
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Expression which evaluates to the right ascension in degrees in the ICRS coordinate system for the request at each row of the input table. This will usually be the name or ID of a column in the input table, or a function involving one.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_dec
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: dec - Declination expression in degrees (ICRS)
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Expression which evaluates to the declination in degrees in the ICRS coordinate system for the request at each row of the input table. This will usually be the name or ID of a column in the input table, or a function involving one.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_sr
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: sr - Search radius in degrees
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Expression which evaluates to the search radius in degrees for the request at each row of the input table. This will often be a constant numerical value, but may be the name or ID of a column in the input table, or a function involving one.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_find
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: find - Type of match to perform
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines which matches are retained. If best is selected, then only the query table row which best matches the row from the input table will be output. If all is selected, then any rows in the query table which match the input table are output.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_copycols
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: copycols - Columns to be copied from input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: List of columns from the input table which are to be copied to the output table. Each column identified here will be prepended to the columns of the combined output table, and its value for each row taken from the input table row which provided the parameters of the query which produced it. See the manual for list syntax. The default setting is "*", which means that all columns from the input table are included in the output.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_scorecol
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: scorecol - Angular distance output column name
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Gives the name of a column in the output table to contain the distance between the requested central position and the actual position of the returned row. The distance returned is an angular distance in degrees. If a null value is chosen, no distance column will appear in the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_parallel
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: parallel - Number of queries to make in parallel
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Allows multiple cone searches to be performed concurrently. If set to the default value, 1, the cone query corresponding to the first row of the input table will be dispatched, when that is completed the query corresponding to the second row will be dispatched, and so on. If set to <n>, then queries will be overlapped in such a way that up to approximately <n> may be running at any one time. Whether this is a good idea, and what might be a sensible maximum value for <n>, depends on the characteristics of the service being queried.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_erract
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: erract - Action on cone search failure
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines what will happen if any of the individual cone search requests fails. By default the task aborts. That may be the best thing to do, but for unreliable or poorly implemented services you may find that some searches fail and others succeed so it can be best to continue operation in the face of a few failures. The options are:
* abort: failure of any query terminates the task * ignore: failure of a query is treated the same as a query which returns no rows * retry: failed queries are retried until they succeed; use with care - if the failure is for some good, or at least reproducible reason this could prevent the task from ever completing * retry<n>: failed queries are retried at most a fixed number <n> of times If they still fail the task terminates.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_ostream
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ostream - Whether output will be strictly streamed
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If set true, this will cause the operation to stream on output, so that the output table is built up as the results are obtained from the cone search service. The disadvantage of this is that some output modes and formats need multiple passes through the data to work, so depending on the output destination, the operation may fail if this is set. Use with care (or be prepared for the operation to fail).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_fixcols
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: fixcols - Whether and how to rename input columns
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines how input columns are renamed before use in the output table. The choices are:
* none: columns are not renamed * dups: columns which would otherwise have duplicate names in the output will be renamed to indicate which table they came from * all: all columns will be renamed to indicate which table they came from
If columns are renamed, the new ones are determined by suffix* parameters.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_suffix0
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: suffix0 - Deduplicating suffix for columns in the input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If the fixcols parameter is set so that input columns are renamed for insertion into the output table, this parameter determines how the renaming is done. It gives a suffix which is appended to all renamed columns from the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_suffix1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: suffix1 - Deduplicating suffix for columns in the cone result table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If the fixcols parameter is set so that input columns are renamed for insertion into the output table, this parameter determines how the renaming is done. It gives a suffix which is appended to all renamed columns from the cone result table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_serviceurl
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: serviceurl - Base URL for query returning VOTable
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
The base part of a URL which defines the queries to be made. Additional parameters will be appended to this using CGI syntax ("name=value", separated by '&' characters). If this value does not end in either a '?' or a '&', one will be added as appropriate.
See the manual for discussion of how to locate service URLs corresponding to given datasets.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: coneskymatch_verb
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: verb - Verbosity level of search responses (1..3)
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Verbosity level of the tables returned by the query service. A value of 1 indicates the bare minimum and 3 indicates all available information.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-regquery
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: regquery: Queries the VO registry

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: regquery_query
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: query - Text of registry query
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Text of an SQL WHERE clause defining which resource records you wish to retrieve from the registry. Some examples are:
* serviceType='CONE' * title like '%2MASS%' * publisher like 'CDS%' and title like '%galax%'
The special value "ALL" will attempt to retrieve all the records in the registry (though this is not necessarily a sensible thing to do).
A full description of SQL syntax is beyond the scope of this documentation, but in general you want to use <field-name> like '<value> where '%' is a wildcard character. Logical operators and and or and parentheses can be used to group and combine expressions. You can find the various <field-name>s by executing one of the queries above and looking at the column names in the returned table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: regquery_regurl
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: regurl - URL of registry service
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The URL of a SOAP endpoint which provides suitable registry query services.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: regquery_ocmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ocmd - Processing command(s) for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the output table, after all other processing has taken place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "ocmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: regquery_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: regquery_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tcat
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tcat: Concatenates multiple similar tables

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table(s)
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Locations of the input tables.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.
The same format parameter applies to all the tables specified by in.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_istream
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: istream - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
If set true, the in table will be read as a stream. It is necessary to give the ifmt parameter in this case. Depending on the required operations and processing mode, this may cause the read to fail (sometimes it is necessary to read the input table more than once). It is not normally necessary to set this flag; in most cases the data will be streamed automatically if that is the best thing to do. However it can sometimes result in less resource usage when processing large files in certain formats (such as VOTable).
The same streaming flag applies to all the tables specified by in.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_icmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd - Processing command(s) for each input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands which will operate on each of the input tables, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_ocmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ocmd - Processing command(s) for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the output table, after all other processing has taken place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "ocmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_seqcol
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: seqcol - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Name of a column to be added to the output table which will contain the sequence number of the input table from which each row originated. This column will contain 1 for the rows from the first concatenated table, 2 for the second, and so on.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_loccol
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: loccol - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Name of a column to be added to the output table which will contain the location (as specified in the input parameter(s)) of the input table from which each row originated.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_uloccol
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: uloccol - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Name of a column to be added to the output table which will contain the unique part of the location (as specified in the input parameter(s)) of the input table from which each row originated. If not null, parameters will also be added to the output table giving the pre- and post-fix string common to all the locations. For example, if the input tables are "/data/cat_a1.fits" and "/data/cat_b2.fits" then the output table will contain a new column <colname> which takes the value "a1" for rows from the first table and "b2" for rows from the second, and new parameters "<colname>_prefix" and "<colname>_postfix" with the values "/data/cat_" and ".fits" respectively.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_lazy
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: lazy - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Whether to perform table resolution lazily. If true, each table is only accessed when the time comes to add its rows to the output; if false, then all the tables are accessed up front. This is mostly a tuning parameter, and on the whole it doesn't matter much how it is set, but for joining an enormous number of tables setting it true may avoid running out of resources.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcat_countrows
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: countrows - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Whether to count the rows in the table before starting the output. This is essentially a tuning parameter - if writing to an output format which requires the number of rows up front (such as normal FITS) it may result in skipping the number of passes through the input files required for processing. Unless you have a good understanding of the internals of the software, your best bet for working out whether to set this true or false is to try it both ways

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tcopy
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tcopy: Converts between table formats

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcopy_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcopy_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcopy_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcopy_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tcube
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tcube: Calculates N-dimensional histograms

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_cols
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: cols - Space-separated list of input columns
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Columns to use for this task. One or more <col-id> elements, separated by spaces, should be given. Each one represents a column in the table, using either its name or index.
The number of columns listed in the value of this parameter defines the dimensionality of the output data cube.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_istream
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: istream - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If set true, the in table will be read as a stream. It is necessary to give the ifmt parameter in this case. Depending on the required operations and processing mode, this may cause the read to fail (sometimes it is necessary to read the input table more than once). It is not normally necessary to set this flag; in most cases the data will be streamed automatically if that is the best thing to do. However it can sometimes result in less resource usage when processing large files in certain formats (such as VOTable).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_icmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd - Processing command(s) for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_bounds
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: bounds - Data bounds for each dimension
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Gives the bounds for each dimension of the cube in data coordinates. The form of the value is a space-separated list of words, each giving an optional lower bound, then a colon, then an optional upper bound, for instance "1:100 0:20" to represent a range for two-dimensional output between 1 and 100 of the first coordinate (table column) and between 0 and 20 for the second. Either or both numbers may be omitted to indicate that the bounds should be determined automatically by assessing the range of the data in the table. A null value for the parameter indicates that all bounds should be determined automatically for all the dimensions.
If any of the bounds need to be determined automatically in this way, two passes through the data will be required, the first to determine bounds and the second to populate the cube.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_binsizes
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: binsizes - Extent of bins in each dimension
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Gives the extent of of the data bins (cube pixels) in each dimension in data coordinates. The form of the value is a space-separated list of values, giving a list of extents for the first, second, ... dimension. Either this parameter or the nbins parameter must be supplied.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_nbins
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: nbins - Number of bins in each dimension
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Gives the number of bins (cube pixels) in each dimension. The form of the value is a space-separated list of integers, giving the number of pixels for the output cube in the first, second, ... dimension. Either this parameter or the binsizes parameter must be supplied.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output FITS file
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output file.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_otype
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: otype - Type of output array elements
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The type of numeric value which will fill the output array. If no selection is made, the output type will be determined automatically as the shortest type required to hold all the values in the array. Currently, integers are always signed (no BSCALE/BZERO), so for instance the largest value that can be recorded in 8 bits is 127.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tcube_scale
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: scale - Value by which to scale counts
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Optionally gives a value by which the count in each bin is scaled. If this value is null (the default) then for each row that falls within the bounds of a pixel, the pixel value will be incremented by 1. If a column ID is given, then instead of 1 being added, the value of that column for the row in question is added. The effect of this is that the output image contains the mean of the given column for the rows corresponding to each pixel rather than just a count of them.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tmatch1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tmatch1: Performs a crossmatch internal to a single table

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_matcher
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: matcher - Name of matching algorithm
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Defines the nature of the matching that will be performed. Depending on the name supplied, this may be positional matching using celestial or Cartesian coordinates, exact matching on the value of a string column, or other things. A list and explanation of the available matching algorithms is given in the manual. The value supplied for this parameter determines the meanings of the values required by the params and values* parameter(s).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_params
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: params - Match parameters
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines the parameters of this match. This is typically one or more tolerances such as error radii. It may contain zero or more values; the values that are required depend on the match type selected by the matcher parameter. If it contains multiple values, they must be separated by spaces; values which contain a space can be 'quoted' or "quoted".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_values
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: values - Expressions for match values
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Defines the values from the input table which are used to determine whether a match has occurred. These will typically be coordinate values such as RA and Dec and perhaps some per-row error values as well, though exactly what values are required is determined by the kind of match as determined by matcher. Depending on the kind of match, the number and type of the values required will be different. Multiple values should be separated by whitespace; if whitespace occurs within a single value it must be 'quoted' or "quoted". Elements of the expression list are commonly just column names, but may be algebraic expressions calculated from zero or more columns as explained in the manual.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_action
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: action - Type of output table to generate from matching
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines the form of the table which will be output as a result of the internal match.
* identify: The output table is the same as the input table except that it contains two additional columns, GroupID and GroupSize, following the input columns. Each group of rows which matched is assigned a unique integer, recorded in the GroupID column, and the size of each group is recorded in the GroupSize column. Rows which don't match any others (singles) have null values in both these columns. * keep0: The result is a new table containing only "single" rows, that is ones which don't match any other rows in the table. Any other rows are thrown out. * keep1: The result is a new table in which only one row (the first in the input table order) from each group of matching ones is retained. A subsequent intra-table match with the same criteria would therefore show no matches. * wideN: The result is a new "wide" table consisting of matched rows in the input table stacked next to each other. Only groups of exactly N rows in the input table are used to form the output table; each row of the output table consists of the columns of the first group member, followed by the columns of the second group member and so on. The output table therefore has N times as many columns as the input table. The column names in the new table have _1, _2, ... appended to them to avoid duplication.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_progress
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: progress - Report progress to screen
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines whether information on progress of the match should be output to the standard error stream as it progresses. For lengthy matches this is a useful reassurance and can give guidance about how much longer it will take. It can also be useful as a performance diagnostic.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_istream
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: istream - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If set true, the in table will be read as a stream. It is necessary to give the ifmt parameter in this case. Depending on the required operations and processing mode, this may cause the read to fail (sometimes it is necessary to read the input table more than once). It is not normally necessary to set this flag; in most cases the data will be streamed automatically if that is the best thing to do. However it can sometimes result in less resource usage when processing large files in certain formats (such as VOTable).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_icmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd - Processing command(s) for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_ocmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ocmd - Processing command(s) for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the output table, after all other processing has taken place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "ocmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch1_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tmatch2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tmatch2: Crossmatches 2 tables using flexible criteria

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_ifmt1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt1 - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the first input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_in1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in1 - Location of first input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the first input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_ifmt2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt2 - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the second input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_in2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in2 - Location of second input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the second input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_icmd1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd1 - Processing command(s) for input table 1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the first input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd1=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_icmd2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: icmd2 - Processing command(s) for input table 2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the second input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd2=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_ocmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ocmd - Processing command(s) for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the output table, after all other processing has taken place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "ocmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_matcher
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: matcher - Name of matching algorithm
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Defines the nature of the matching that will be performed. Depending on the name supplied, this may be positional matching using celestial or Cartesian coordinates, exact matching on the value of a string column, or other things. A list and explanation of the available matching algorithms is given in the manual. The value supplied for this parameter determines the meanings of the values required by the params and values* parameter(s).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_values1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: values1 - Expressions for match values from table 1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Defines the values from table 1 which are used to determine whether a match has occurred. These will typically be coordinate values such as RA and Dec and perhaps some per-row error values as well, though exactly what values are required is determined by the kind of match as determined by matcher. Depending on the kind of match, the number and type of the values required will be different. Multiple values should be separated by whitespace; if whitespace occurs within a single value it must be 'quoted' or "quoted". Elements of the expression list are commonly just column names, but may be algebraic expressions calculated from zero or more columns as explained in the manual.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_values2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: values2 - Expressions for match values from table 2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Defines the values from table 2 which are used to determine whether a match has occurred. These will typically be coordinate values such as RA and Dec and perhaps some per-row error values as well, though exactly what values are required is determined by the kind of match as determined by matcher. Depending on the kind of match, the number and type of the values required will be different. Multiple values should be separated by whitespace; if whitespace occurs within a single value it must be 'quoted' or "quoted". Elements of the expression list are commonly just column names, but may be algebraic expressions calculated from zero or more columns as explained in the manual.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_params
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: params - Match parameters
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines the parameters of this match. This is typically one or more tolerances such as error radii. It may contain zero or more values; the values that are required depend on the match type selected by the matcher parameter. If it contains multiple values, they must be separated by spaces; values which contain a space can be 'quoted' or "quoted".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_join
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: join - Selection criteria for output rows
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines which rows are included in the output table. The matching algorithm determines which of the rows from the first table correspond to which rows from the second. This parameter determines what to do with that information. Perhaps the most obvious thing is to write out a table containing only rows which correspond to a row in both of the two input tables. However, you may also want to see the unmatched rows from one or both input tables, or rows present in one table but unmatched in the other, or other possibilities. The options are:
* 1and2: An output row for each row represented in both input tables * 1or2: An output row for each row represented in either or both of the input tables * all1: An output row for each matched or unmatched row in table 1 * all2: An output row for each matched or unmatched row in table 2 * 1not2: An output row only for rows which appear in the first table but are not matched in the second table * 2not1: An output row only for rows which appear in the second table but are not matched in the first table * 1xor2: An output row only for rows represented in one of the input tables but not the other one

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_find
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: find - Type of match to perform
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines which matches are retained. If best is selected, then only the best match between the two tables will be retained; in this case the data from a row of either input table will appear in at most one row of the output table. If all is selected, then all pairs of rows from the two input tables which match the input criteria will be represented in the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_fixcols
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: fixcols - Whether and how to rename input columns
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines how input columns are renamed before use in the output table. The choices are:
* none: columns are not renamed * dups: columns which would otherwise have duplicate names in the output will be renamed to indicate which table they came from * all: all columns will be renamed to indicate which table they came from
If columns are renamed, the new ones are determined by suffix* parameters.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_suffix1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: suffix1 - Deduplicating suffix for columns in table 1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If the fixcols parameter is set so that input columns are renamed for insertion into the output table, this parameter determines how the renaming is done. It gives a suffix which is appended to all renamed columns from table 1.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_suffix2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: suffix2 - Deduplicating suffix for columns in table 2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: If the fixcols parameter is set so that input columns are renamed for insertion into the output table, this parameter determines how the renaming is done. It gives a suffix which is appended to all renamed columns from table 2.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_scorecol
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: scorecol - Match score output column name
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Gives the name of a column in the output table to contain the "match score" for each pairwise match. The meaning of this column is dependent on the chosen matcher, but it typically represents a distance of some kind between the two matching points. If a null value is chosen, no score column will be inserted in the output table. The default value of this parameter depends on matcher.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tmatch2_progress
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: progress - Report progress to screen
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines whether information on progress of the match should be output to the standard error stream as it progresses. For lengthy matches this is a useful reassurance and can give guidance about how much longer it will take. It can also be useful as a performance diagnostic.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tpipe
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tpipe: Performs pipeline processing on a table

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tpipe_ifmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tpipe_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Location of input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tpipe_cmd
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: cmd - Processing command(s) for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Commands to operate on the input table, before any other processing takes place.
The value of this parameter is one or more of the filter commands described in the manual. If more than one is given, they must be separated by semicolon characters (";"). This parameter can be repeated multiple times on the same command line to build up a list of processing steps. The sequence of commands given in this way defines the processing pipeline which is performed on the table.
Commands may alteratively be supplied in an external file, by using the indirection character '@'. Thus "icmd=@filename" causes the file filename to be read for a list of filter commands to execute. The commands in the file may be separated by newline characters and/or semicolons.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tpipe_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tpipe_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-tskymatch2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: tskymatch2: Crossmatches 2 tables on sky position

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_ifmt1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt1 - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the first input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_in1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in1 - Location of first input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the first input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_ifmt2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ifmt2 - Format name for input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Specifies the format of the second input table (one of the known formats listed in the manual). This flag can be used if you know what format your input table is in. If it has the special value (auto) (the default), then an attempt will be made to detect the format of the table automatically. This cannot always be done correctly however, in which case the program will exit with an error explaining which formats were attempted.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_in2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in2 - Location of second input table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the second input table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Location of output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The location of the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_ofmt
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ofmt - Format name for output table
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Specifies the format in which the output table will be written (one of the ones in the manual - matching is case-insensitive and you can use just the first few letters). If it has the special value "(auto)" (the default), then the output filename will be examined to try to guess what sort of file is required usually by looking at the extension. If it's not obvious from the filename what output format is intended, an error will result.
This parameter must only be given if omode has its default value of "out".

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_ra1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ra1 - Expression for table 1 right ascension in degrees
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Value in degrees for the right ascension of positions in table 1 to be matched. This may simply be a column name, or it may be an algebraic expression calculated from columns as explained in the manual. If left blank, an attempt is made to guess from UCDs, column names and unit annotations what expression to use.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_dec1
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: dec1 - Expression for table 1 declination in degrees
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Value in degrees for the declination of positions in table 1 to be matched. This may simply be a column name, or it may be an algebraic expression calculated from columns as explained in the manual. If left blank, an attempt is made to guess from UCDs, column names and unit annotations what expression to use.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_ra2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: ra2 - Expression for table 2 right ascension in degrees
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Value in degrees for the right ascension of positions in table 2 to be matched. This may simply be a column name, or it may be an algebraic expression calculated from columns as explained in the manual. If left blank, an attempt is made to guess from UCDs, column names and unit annotations what expression to use.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_dec2
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: dec2 - Expression for table 2 declination in degrees
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Value in degrees for the declination of positions in table 2 to be matched. This may simply be a column name, or it may be an algebraic expression calculated from columns as explained in the manual. If left blank, an attempt is made to guess from UCDs, column names and unit annotations what expression to use.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_error
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: error - Maximum separation in arcsec
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: The maximum separation permitted between two objects for them to count as a match. Units are arc seconds.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_join
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: join - Selection criteria for output rows
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description:
Determines which rows are included in the output table. The matching algorithm determines which of the rows from the first table correspond to which rows from the second. This parameter determines what to do with that information. Perhaps the most obvious thing is to write out a table containing only rows which correspond to a row in both of the two input tables. However, you may also want to see the unmatched rows from one or both input tables, or rows present in one table but unmatched in the other, or other possibilities. The options are:
* 1and2: An output row for each row represented in both input tables * 1or2: An output row for each row represented in either or both of the input tables * all1: An output row for each matched or unmatched row in table 1 * all2: An output row for each matched or unmatched row in table 2 * 1not2: An output row only for rows which appear in the first table but are not matched in the second table * 2not1: An output row only for rows which appear in the second table but are not matched in the first table * 1xor2: An output row only for rows represented in one of the input tables but not the other one

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: tskymatch2_find
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: find - Type of match to perform
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines which matches are retained. If best is selected, then only the best match between the two tables will be retained; in this case the data from a row of either input table will appear in at most one row of the output table. If all is selected, then all pairs of rows from the two input tables which match the input criteria will be represented in the output table.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-votcopy
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: votcopy: Transforms between VOTable encodings

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_in
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: in - Input votable
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Location of the input VOTable. May be a URL, filename, or "-" to indicate standard input. The input table may be compressed using one of the known compression formats (Unix compress, gzip or bzip2).

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - Output votable
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Location of the output VOTable.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_format
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: format - Output votable format
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines the encoding format of the table data in the output document. If null is selected, then the tables will be data-less (will contain no DATA element), leaving only the document structure. Data-less tables are legal VOTable elements.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_charset
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: charset - null
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Selects the Unicode encoding used for the output XML. The available options and default are dependent on your JVM, but the default probably corresponds to UTF-8. Use help=charset for a full listing.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_cache
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: cache - Read data into cache before copying?
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines whether the input tables are read into a cache prior to being written out. The default is selected automatically depending on the input table; so you should normally leave this flag alone.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_href
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: href - Output FITS/BINARY data external to output document?
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: In the case of BINARY or FITS encoding, this determines whether the STREAM elements output will contain their data inline or externally. If set false, the output document will be self-contained, with STREAM data inline as base64-encoded characters. If true, then for each TABLE in the document the binary data will be written to a separate file and referenced by an href attribute on the corresponding STREAM element. The name of these files is usually determined by the name of the main output file; but see also the base flag.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votcopy_base
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: base - Base location for FITS/BINARY href data
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Determines the name of external output files written when the href flag is true. Normally these are given names based on the name of the output file. But if this flag is given, the names will be based on the <location> string. This flag is compulsory if href is true and out=- (output is to standard out), since in this case there is no default base name to use.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TASK-votlint
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: task
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: votlint: Validates VOTable documents

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votlint_votable
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: votable - VOTable location
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Location of the VOTable to be checked.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votlint_validate
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: validate - Validate against VOTable DTD?
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Whether to validate the input document aganist the VOTable DTD. If true (the default), then as well as votlint's own checks, it is validated against an appropriate version of the VOTable DTD which picks up such things as the presence of unknown elements and attributes, elements in the wrong place, and so on. Sometimes however, particularly when XML namespaces are involved, the validator can get confused and may produce a lot of spurious errors. Setting this flag false prevents this validation step so that only votlint 's own checks are performed. In this case many violations of the VOTable standard concerning document structure will go unnoticed.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votlint_version
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: version - VOTable standard version
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Selects the version of the VOTable standard which the input table is supposed to exemplify. Currently the version can be 1.0 or 1.1. The version may also be specified within the document using the "version" attribute of the document's VOTABLE element; if it is and it conflicts with the value specified by this flag, a warning is issued.

ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.name: votlint_out
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Name: out - File for output messages
ceai:CmdLineParameterDefn.UI_Description: Destination file for output messages.

Application.LongName: STILTS - Starlink Tables Infrastructure Library Tool Set
Application.Description: STILTS is a package which provides a number of table manipulation functions. The following tasks (profiles) are provided: calc: Evaluates expressions coneskymatch: Crossmatches table on sky position against Cone Search service regquery: Queries the VO registry tcat: Concatenates multiple similar tables tcopy: Converts between table formats tcube: Calculates N-dimensional histograms tmatch1: Performs a crossmatch internal to a single table tmatch2: Crossmatches 2 tables using flexible criteria tpipe: Performs pipeline processing on a table tskymatch2: Crossmatches 2 tables on sky position votcopy: Transforms between VOTable encodings votlint: Validates VOTable documents
